entry.title: Radiation and Its Health Effects
entry.author: United States Nuclear Regulatory Commission
entry.description: Notice the image and chart at the bottom. A 3-millirem exposure is equally likely to kill you as smoking one cigarette. Living near or working on a nuclear powerplant for a full year results in 0.10 millirem. It can be concluded that smoking one cigarette is about as dangerous as living near or on a nuclear powerplant for 30 years.
